languageDescription: A simple circle
An equilateral triagnle
A square
A regular pentagon
Two adjacent equilateral traingles sharing a common base, forming a symmetrical figure along a vertical axis
A square and an equilateral triangle sharing the right side of the square symmetrical horizontally
A circle inscribed in a square

a circle with several straight lines intersecting at the center, dividing the circle into eight equal sections. The lines extend from the center to the circumference of the circle, creating eight pie-like segments.

a simple line drawing of a face on a circular background. The face consists of two circles of the same size representing the eyes, placed above the centerline of the larger circle. Below and between the eyes is an equilateral triangle pointing downwards, representing the nose. There are no other facial features like a mouth, ears, or eyebrows depicted. The lines are consistent in thickness, and the overall design is minimalist and symmetrical.

a series of three and a half steps that look like a staircase viewed from the side. Starting from the top left, there is a short horizontal line that moves to the right, followed by a vertical line going downwards, forming the first step. This is followed by two more full steps, each consisting of a horizontal line followed by a vertical line. After the third step, there is a final horizontal line that represents the half step, without a subsequent vertical line descending from it. The lines are consistent in thickness and the steps are evenly spaced, creating a simple, clean geometric pattern.
Two adjacent equilateral traingles sharing a horizontal common base, where the left triangle is larger than the right one
Three adjacent equilateral traingles sharing a common base, forming a symmetrical figure along a vertical axis
Three adjacent squares sharing a common base, side by side, enclosed within a larger rectangle, resembling a segmented bar
A square inscribed in a circle
a square with its two diagonals
a square with one of its diagonals from top left to bottom right
a square with one of its diagonals from top right to bottom left
two squares connected at one corner. The square on the top left is aligned with the bottom right square such that one of its sides continues as one side of the other square
Two circles on top of each other
a combination of a semicircle on top and an equilateral triangle beneath it, sharing the same base, resembling an ice cream cone
two distinct circles placed adjacently, touching at one ponint. The larger circle is to the left, and the smaller circle is to the right.
